reviews.text: This is the second time I have stayed at the Puri Raja and it won't be the last! The location is excellent, the rooms/ bathrooms clean and modern, breakfast is delicious with a beautiful view to the beach, the gardens are meticulous and the staff are fantastic. My family (2 adults 2 children- 5 & 7) stayed in interconnecting rooms for 1 week before trying other hotels and we wish we had stayed longer. The Puri Raja is quite a small hotel and very friendly. Most of the other guests seemed to be repeat customers too.
reviews.title: The Best Budget Hotel!

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, location and lay-out of hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Puri Raja in late October in a Deluxe Room. In general I would say that the location was good and the hotel was very good value for money. The service was fairly good and the rooms were reasonably clean. It is not 5 star but it was very comfortable and bang for buck.
reviews.title: Good Value for Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This resort didnt attract much of a classy crowd (ie loud drunks) when we were there. But everyone was really friendly and it was a good sized hotel.... not too small and not too big.
reviews.title: Love Puri Raja

reviews.text: I would recommend Puri Raja to anyone looking for a reasonably nice and clean place to stay. If you want good value, this would be quite unbeatable. So long as you werent expecting a very quiet and romantic 5 star resort.
reviews.title: puri raja excellent value

reviews.text: Puri Raja Hotel is a great hotel in the centre of Legian. A la carte breakfast is served with views of the beach. The pool, rooms and bathrooms have all been renovated and is very modern with great amenities for the price.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great little hotel right on the beach. Friendly staff & clean rooms. The only gripe would be the bathroom towels could do with replacing ... they have seen better days !!
reviews.title: Again we loved Puri Raja

reviews.text: Another great holiday in glorious Bali.
reviews.title: Puri Raja - Loved it's small, more traditional Balinese style accomodation

reviews.text: We booked the Puri Raja in May 2010, we were 2 families traveling with teenagers ( 13 & 15yrs).We chose this hotel on the advise of my sister in law who has stayed here several times as it is right on the beach and surrounded by some pretty good restaurants. Everything was close by.. Our rooms were always cleaned by the time we came back from breaky. Not sure if this was a fluke...as our friends didn't always have the same luck. (they stayed in the deluxe rooms at beach end)There are 2 pools one large one at the reception end, which is off the street side and one on the beach end with a swim up pool bar and the restaurant over looking the beach...we didnt mind the quietness of the smaller hotel, we had arrived before the school holidays had started and didnt find it a problem getting deck chairs, however once school holidays hit there seemed to be an influx of people around the pool and again the inconsiderate ones who left their towels on deck chairs for hours with the aim of reserving them for the day. Not on in my books, we have all payed to stay there. So on one occasion we just moved the towels and figured if they came back we would move and hopefully they would get the message. The longest we would sit around the pool was usually only for a couple of hours anyway , cause when the sun was out it was really hot..( hense we never saw the owners of the towels while we were using the chairs) this might seem petty but hey we are all on a holiday to relax...We always felt very safe at the hotel, we even left the teenagers at night so us adults could have some down time and a nice quite dinner... there are shops all along the front street side so you dont have to walk to far to grab a bargain......we would happily stay there again. On check in ( even after several phone calls and emails as to making sure they put the kids next to us as they kept telling me they didnt have interconnecting rooms ) they did put our kids at one end of the hotel to us, so i said no this isnt on as i have requested they be next to each other . So i asked what they had closest to our friends in the deluxe rooms and they found 2 rooms downstairs next to each other ( 115 & 116). one was made up and we just had to wait till they cleaned the other room, which was ok as we could use the kids room until ours was ready. Well not even 10mins later our room was all ready for us and quess what they were interconnecting rooms. Go figure! So in the end it worked out in our favour, we were just so happy to have the kids next to us. The hotel was in a great position as you could go for a walk along the beach front ,check out the restaurants, hire surfboards/boogie boards & deck chairs and umbrellas...for 2 deck chairs and brolly it cost us 50,000rp about $6 Aus for as long as we wanted them for..Just down the way a bit was the quick silver surf school so kids did that one day....I could just keep babbling on. We would definatley stay here again. As with all Balinese nothing is ever a problem....
reviews.title: Great small hotel in good location

reviews.text: Oh the only thing we didnt like was the pool towels had to be handed back in by 7pm this i think could be changed to later as the pool bar is open till 1pm. And the kids sometimes wanted to have a swim after going out for dinner & would have had to use their bath towels.....so cheep to have your laundry done there, have it ready for them to collect before 9am and it was always returned by 6pm that evening for a cost of $15-$20 Aus for heaps of clothes, well worth it .....this hotel was great, not a 5 star rating hotel, which we have stayed in in Tuban with 400 + rooms. The Puri Raja is only 68 rooms and would book a small hotel over a larger one any day.....
reviews.title: Absolutely perfect

reviews.text: The hotel is nice and not too big. Gardens are all lovely and well kept. The staff are all friendly, rooms are good all you need. We found the pool closest to the reception to be more quiter and relaxing, but both lovely to swim in. The hotel is in a good location at the beach end is a walkway that joins the road to Kuta on one end and goes to Seminyak at the other. The road end of the hotel has shopping and restaurants, laundry etc. and transport there whenever you need it. Would recommend having a massage in the hut at the beach end of the hotel, with the sounds of the surf, very relaxing. Argo on the beach out the front of the hotel is very friendly and hires out the sun beds and surfboards.
reviews.title: Another great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & i first went to Bali in June 2005. We stayed at the Mandira in Legion and we couldnt fault it.
reviews.title: Watch out for the stairs............

reviews.text: After getting married we flew to Bali the next day this time at the Puri Raja. Friends of ours (14 of them) booked their trip for September this year at the Puri Raja it did come recomended to us.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: Compared to the Mandira the extent to which we could communicate with the staff at the Puri Raja was limited.
reviews.title: Spotlessly clean & fabulous

reviews.text: Remembering this was our honeymoon - we left our hotel room at around 8:00am without showering we had breakfast at the hotel (NOT RECOMENDED) then went down to the beach.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have just returned from a 7 night stay at Puri Raja and wanted to let everyone know how wonderful this hotel was. From check in to check out was brillant .
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed on the top floor room 231,this was at reception end of hotel near what we called the deep pool. There was another pool down the beach end of the hotel this pool to us was alittle bit noisey for our liking but great for the younger ones. Saying that there wasnt many children staying at this hotel.
reviews.title: GREAT LITTLE HOTEL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would like to say there Breakfast was excellent not your buffet style, but you where able to choose from the menu anything you liked and best of all it was cooked fresh. Bannana pancakes yum yum.
reviews.title: Another Great Time at the Puri.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was cleaned everyday and the boys did a great job.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.text: Reception staff where wonderful and nothing was ever to much trouble for them.
reviews.title: PR with teens

reviews.text: This is my 7th trip to Bali and we invited our friends and family to share for my 50th Birthday. The Puri Raja has the best location and the hotel is so nice and friendly.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 weeks and were very sad to leave.
reviews.title: Great location & value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was great , just order off the menu.
reviews.title: Great Hotel ruined by a few

reviews.text: The staff so friendly..
reviews.title: Friendly Family Hotel

reviews.text: My only issue is having to single beds pushed together to make a king kept falling apart while sleeping but not a great problem
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, location, staff and price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I (mid 40's) just returned from a 7 night stay at the Puri Raja. Being our 8th visit to Bali, and our first at Puri Raja, we knew there is a great difference between Bali 3 star and what we would expect at home. Well, what a great return for our money. Checked in quickly and taken straight to our room (214, upstairs at beach end of hotel). Room appeared freshly painted. Reasonable size and nicely furnished. Bathroom (like many Bali hotels) was a bit average, but clean as anything. Bath towels and bed sheets a bit grey, but clean.
reviews.title: Best location in Bali, right on the beach and close to great restaurants etc

reviews.text: Pool area great and restaurant overlooking the ocean great for the included breakfast (order what you want from the menu, no overcooked and stewed buffets).
reviews.title: A great value 3 star hotel in the middle of Legian

reviews.text: This hotel for us was in the pick of locations in Bali. A short walk either way to great restaurants/bars, and lots of shopping options available.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Although we didn't eat poolside, the staff were always friendly and polite. Breakfast service was great.
reviews.title: Gone Downhill

reviews.text: Massage and spa treatments were reasonably priced for hotel supplied ones.
reviews.title: Not a happy customer.. never again!!
